channel.title: USA Computing Olympiad
channel.description:
This is mainly targeted at high school students, though adults and observers may participate. Participation is open to foreigners as well. Ranked competition is among all secondary students. There are divisions: Bronze, Silver (Invitational), Gold (Invitational), and you can get an invite to higher divisions by performing well in the previous divisions. Training problems are also available to build up programming skills and learn algorithms. The competition supports Java, C, and Pascal.
I have no affiliation with this aside from participation, but I thought that some people from this forum might consider participating. There's a competition every month for most of the year.
Main page: http://www.uwp.edu/sws/usaco/ Sample of previous competitions (and the current one): http://ace.delos.com/contestgate
